detailsOfAchievement: Our organisation is the first association formed by the parents in the state of Andhra Pradesh in the year 1986. We are having two projectss ie. special school for the differently abled below aged of 18 years and for 18 years and above we have vocational training centre. In special school we impart training in special education, physiotherapy yoga, occupational therapy , psychological assessment, counseling and guidance, speech therapy, music and dance, behavour modication apart from basic training right brushing of teeth to taking bath etc. we want them to be independent. In vocational training centre we impart training , candle making, paper bag making and also sale them. We have 30 staff members thats include special educators, paramedical staff , vocational instructor, and other administrative staff. we have successfully completed 29 years. We have our own building and two vehicle for transport. In the month of july 2015 we had opportunity to meet H E President of India during his visit to R.P.Nilayam, Hyderabad on 6.07.2015.

The building comprises of 12class rooms, office room, halls for vocational activity, physiotherapy and speech therapy. 75% of the building is completed besides leveling of the ground and completion of compound. We have shifted the school VTC and Early intervention center into the new building. The entire construction was met from the donation received from individuals NRIs and Corporate sector. â€¢ Purchased 25 seater Mahindra make bus from ANDRA BANK funds and seven seater TATA magic van for transporting students and staff. â€¢ Actively participating in rights movement, as we are executive members in confederation of parents association (PARIVAAR). â€¢ Sri R. Satish, 25 years age who was trained in our school and VTC is presently working in a coffee shop. â€¢ Sri B. Sadanandam, 35 years age is also now leading independent life. â€¢ Sri. sourceOfFunds.purpose: SAI EDU had undertaken in conducting computer training courses Basic tailoring , Fashion designing, Beautician, Pre-primary Teacher Training programmes for near about 200 women/men youth for each course at NALGONDA District. Telangana State. The programme was undertaken from SETWIN the Govt. Society of Telangana State and grants were received from MEPMA.

The organization is running Old age Home for aged people and widow women at Nalgonda, NALGONDA district of A.P. we are conducting Physiotherapy programme for old people and needy. The programme was very useful needy and the response was more than 80% per month.

Our organization conducted Free Coaching for Scheduled Castes, Scheduled Tribes and OBC students. The following courses are offered in this year, a) RRB, b) LIC/Banks c) SSC d) EAMCET (Engineering) , e) EAMCET (Medical) most of the students are successfully completed their coaching and got good results in their respective exams, for current year response there is move. Our organization is planning to contact Minister of Social Justice and Empowerment. Govt. of India , New Delhi for the sanction

As it is very much aware that NALGONDA district of Telangana is cursed with florosis there are many physically challenged youth who were affected by florosis. During 2018 responded and took special care over the physically challenged youth I conducting special vocational training programmes such as computer training, fashion designing, embroidery, cloth painting, mehindi etc., there was a good response near about 200 young women and men had undertaken the training at only NALGONDA.

detailsOfAchievement: This Our main aim is to serve the poorest human beings and children by promoting social awareness and removing stigma of poverty. Besides taking up several family welfare activities, conducting medical and health camps in rural areas since past Ten years, the society is striving its best to educate women and small farmers on income generation programmes. We are making efforts to establish residential instructions with vocational courses, adult education centers, libraries for girls of rural and slum areas to sensitize the downtrodden sections of society. This could be possible due to having good rapport with government departments and local community. This organization is planning to foster secularism and harmony among people through development programmes. Our endeavour is to ensure sustainable development, harmony, peace, and make the people self-reliant. We mainly focused on awareness programme on different local issues, few are illustrated here under â€¢ Consumer awareness camp â€¢ HIV/AIDS awareness camp â€¢ Income generation training â€¢ Special camp for adolescent girls of tribal areas. â€¢ Free tailoring training â€¢ Organic farming to small farmers â€¢ Adult education programme â€¢ Literacy awareness programme â€¢ Anti Arrack campaign â€¢ Pulse Polio camp â€¢ Health and Blood camp â€¢ Nutrition food to child labour â€¢ General awareness camp â€¢ Seminar against dowry, child and widow marriages â€¢ Shields to merit students â€¢ Clean and green programme at Medaram â€¢ Free eye and medical Camp â€¢ Chickengunya prevention programme â€¢ Cultural programmes for rural youth â€¢ Note books to poor students of SC & BC hostels.

detailsOfAchievement: Samdani Educational Society has been working in the Slum Area of Hyderabad city since 1993, in the filed of education for economically and educationally backward minorities. Society had established High School recognised by Govt. of A.P. NCPUL M/o H.R.D had sanctioned Computer Centre, Urdu and Arabic Diploma Centre to Society, During 2004 University of Calicut, Kerala had approved study centre to Society for Distance Education. Society had organised various programmes like Education Rally, Child Labour Eradication Programme, Sports Meet, Seminars, Science Exhibitions, Educational Tours, Carrier Guidance Programme, Health Awareness Programme, Free Medical Camp, Eye Camp, etc. Society had organised many events by name Brain Contest, an inter school and inter college competition. Many studetns who got certificates from our organisation has been doing jobs in various places in different fields.

detailsOfAchievement: Improvement of Hindi in Government School Improvement of Mathematics Experiments in Science Know your village project Parents teachers meeting Training of teachers

sourceOfFunds.purpose: Our sanctioned budget from ICCO expired in December 2013. Request for renewal was rejected on the ground that ICCO decided to move out of Bihar. Hence we did not have grant during the year.

Phase I of the pilot project completed. We worked with 2000 girls from SC and OBC community. We trained warden and teachers of 20 KGBV. Our field facilitators visited 20 schools 4 times in a month and provided handholding support to teachers in carrying out class transactions in improving Hindi, Mathematics. We facilitated Know your village project. 1100 participated the project and children made presentation in front of teachers, parents and Administration.
Phase II of the project implemented successfully. Team worked with 2000 girls from 20 KGBV coming from OBC and SC community of Nalanda District.

Phase III one quarter I work has been done. Hence we have only spent the money for one quarter by August 2017. Our team continue to visit 20 KGBV and provide input for improvement in Hindi, diary writing, use of library and facilitate know your village project.

detailsOfAchievement: Sayodhya is a home for women in need our primary objective continues as mandated to reach out to the needy women and stand by them. Since its establishment in 2010 to till date Sayodhya has provided emergency shelter to more than 1000 women. Opened free family counseling centers in 10 urban slums in Hyderabad where women themselves address cases of crimes against women. 2000 underprivileged students have been covered since 2011 with vocational training and orientation on job placement. around 500 underprivileged young women from rural and urban AP were imparted Professional Development Course on ECCE. 600 women and young girls received Shelter and food at Sayodhya Home so far and 200 girls pursuing further education stayed at Sayodhya. Cases of Domestic Violence, harassments, child marriages, physical and mental abuses for 1500 women have been addressed so far providing support in the form of legal and psychological counseling. 500 young girls were placed in different jobs after successful skill building and job trainings. Reached 600 girls from poor socioeconomic backgrounds for supporting their education. Prepared 30 youth girls for writing degree entrance and 15 students for open 10 class examination.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: One of the main Objectives of the organisation is Skill building, soft-skills training. In partnership with Employment Generation and Marketing Mission, Department of Rural Development, Andhra Pradesh, Sayodhya carried out a 45-days module of preschool teachers training course for underprivileged young women on child centred education pedagogy, life skill training, facilitating internships, and their placement as Early Childhood Education Instructors/professionals.

Sayodhya is assisting in their residential requirements providing short stay home, that is, temporary shelter to accommodate them from one day to a week. In September 2014, the GHMC allotted a Community Hall to support Sayodhya in providing free night shelter for these women in distress. Sayodhya also takes up cases of YOUNG WOMEN who are affected by domestic violence and assist them to avail and enjoy their rights as per the DV Act.
